data:
We will organize a stay at the lodging of the Erve, in Saulges in the Coëvrons, department of Mayenne, from 6 to 17 August 2018, with a group of 46 young Spaniards, Poles, Irish, Estonians and French, from 14 to 17 .

The project is an environmental project, we want to fight against food waste
                             
The two strong ideas of this project are:

-Better to conserve not to waste and indirectly fight against global warming by proposing other modes of consumption

-Difficult to produce, easy to discard

To carry out our project, we will propose to the groups to leave that a starting point and weigh our food waste

Following this initial observation, using different means such as:

* working with menus and teams during the stay
* cooking the right amount rather than being delivered
* promote self-service: the salad'bar
* adapt the portions served: plates "small hunger" and "great hunger"
* use fresh products,
* work, buy from local producers,
* valorize the right foods, by educating to taste,
* use unsold, ugly vegetables, "broken mouths"

We will try to reduce our waste to the strict minimum throughout the stay
We will continue to weigh our wastes for 12 days to verify our ability to reduce them

We will be helped by the association Synergies 53 and the environmental department of the Community of Coëvrons communes to propose quality animations:
A board game: Let's take care of food waste
A Game of Role: The Insolent Meal

To promote the project, raise awareness of food waste, we will organize a DISCO SOUP

A DISCO SOUPE is a great moment of gastronomy and celebration in a convivial and musical atmosphere. The principle: to transform decommissioned fruits and vegetables, destined to be thrown, into a solidarity feast. It happens in four stages: peeling and cutting in music, cooking, distribution of soup or salad to everyone, free then washing, dishes.

We will also participate in a party in a village
-installation of a stand to enhance our action
- help to set up animations
- workshops around the village bread oven, the organic bakery


In parallel, we will work on another axis: Difficult to produce, easy to throw away

We will visit a landfill
We will offer young people to harvest vegetables themselves, to maintain a garden
We will visit a mill, buy our flour to produce our bread
We will visit a bee farm and gather honey, meet local producers who will explain their work
We will even have the opportunity to pass the plow through a field to truly understand the work to be done to produce food
We will cook and prepare our meals as often as possible

In particular, this year we will focus on the project methodology, the learning of young people
We will put on the program a day of reflection to allow young people to learn to analyze, to take stock of their abilities and skills, while being accustomed to take initiatives within a group and to measure their impacts.


We will also work on:

- the European dimension of the project (Game with the Maison de l'Europe of LAVAL, promotion of youth exchanges, ERASMUS +, European mobility at DISCO SOUPE)

-the active involvement of young people in the workshops, in our daily exchanges, in the preparation of the days

-the intercultural dimension by proposing role plays such as GOOD APPETIT

- the visibility of the project by widely disseminating on the site of the Community of Coëvrons communes, relaying our creations on the net, to our partners, local elected representatives, families

Obviously, we will not forget the times of games, the energizers indispensable to the cohesion of the group.

Team: A group of young people decided to try to write a project, after the participation in a specific training on how to write good youth exchanges. Associazione Eufemia chose to support them with the experience in writing European projects and involving some partners of local and international networks.
Description of the project: Urban Sustainability aims to be an opportunity to confront peers from different countries on lifestyles and on the influence of the social context in which you are.
Sport and physical activity, nutrition and the approach to cultural integration change according to the geographical area in which they live. This is why it is important to confront each other and find mutual incentives to inspire good practices and virtuous behavior.
The reflection becomes an opportunity to discover something more about their potential and the ability to take care of themselves, but at the same time also of others and the environment in which they live. Urban spaces become the scenario in which to experiment, increase and improve their soft skills.
Aims:
- promoting youth mobility and cultural integration
- enhance the resources of the urban periphery and the skills of those who live it
- promoting a healthy lifestyle, sporting activity and sustainable nutrition
- promote the values ​​of the Erasmus + program
Participants:
5 participants aged between 16 and 20 for the 6 participating countries + 1 adult Group Leader (2 for Italy).
At least 50% of the participants come from social contexts with fewer opportunities (social, economic, geographical, NEET or drop out risk, unemployed) and gender equality is guaranteed.
Place:
Turin, Italy. Fourth most populous city in Italy, former capital of the automobile industry, in recent years has faced major transformations in the urban and social fabric. The activities will take place in Turin and surroundings, in public or private spaces that can provide adequate support and equipment.
Dates: YE - From 10 to 19 July. The exchange will last 10 days, one of which is considered a travel day.
Methodology:
The project will combine various methodologies and tools: techniques that refer to non-formal education, role and team games, sports activities and creative workshops, linguistic animation and moments of individual and group reflection.
Participating countries: Italy, Bulgaria, UK, Hungary, Macedonia, Portugal.
